verbs.description: steg (third-person singular simple present stegs, present participle stegging, simple past and past participle stegged)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To conceal (data) by means of steganography.
examples: Stego rasterizes the image, then stegs data into the least significant bit (or LSB) of each of the RGB color values.

description: From Middle English steg, from Old Norse steggr, a word for the male of several animals, from Proto-Germanic *staggijaz. Compare stag.
